articles.title: Scientists Discover Brain Circuit That Can Switch Off Chronic Pain
articles.summary: Scientists have pinpointed Y1 receptor neurons in the brain that can override chronic pain signals when survival instincts like hunger or fear take precedence.

articles.title: Scientists Reveal Green Tea’s Fat-Burning Secret
articles.summary: New research shows green tea may help the body burn fat and balance blood sugar.

articles.title: A Single Dose of Psilocybin May Rewire the Brain for Lasting Relief
articles.summary: Penn researchers found that psilocybin can calm brain circuits tied to pain and mood, easing both physical suffering and emotional distress in animal studies.

articles.title: Doctors Tested a Common Drug on COVID. The Results Are Stunning
articles.summary: Inhaled heparin significantly lowers the risk of death and ventilation in COVID-19 patients while also showing potential against other respiratory infections.

articles.title: New Inhaler Halves Childhood Asthma Attacks
articles.summary: A groundbreaking international study has shown that a 2-in-1 budesonide-formoterol inhaler is far more effective than the standard salbutamol inhaler in children with mild asthma.

articles.title: Cocoa Supplements Show Surprising Anti-Aging Potential
articles.summary: Daily cocoa extract supplements reduced key inflammation markers in older adults, pointing to a role in protecting the heart.

articles.title: MIT’s “Stealth” Immune Cells Could Change Cancer Treatment Forever
articles.summary: MIT and Harvard scientists have designed an advanced type of immune cell called a CAR-NK cell that can destroy cancer while avoiding attack from the body’s own immune defenses.

articles.title: Nanotech Transforms Vinegar Into a Lifesaving Superbug Killer
articles.summary: Researchers have enhanced vinegar’s antibacterial properties by infusing it with cobalt-based carbon nanoparticles.

articles.title: Scientists Unlock Nature’s Secret to a Cancer-fighting Molecule
articles.summary: Researchers have cracked the code behind how plants make mitraphylline, a rare cancer-fighting molecule.

articles.title: Bacteria Hidden Inside Tumors Could Help Beat Cancer
articles.summary: Scientists have discovered that bacteria living inside tumors can produce a molecule that fights cancer and enhances chemotherapy.

articles.title: Scientists Finally Reveal What’s Behind Long COVID’s Mysterious Brain Fog
articles.summary: Researchers in Japan have pinpointed a biological cause of Long COVID brain fog using advanced PET brain imaging.

articles.title: Brain Cancer That Eats the Skull Stuns Scientists
articles.summary: A new study shows glioblastoma isn’t confined to the brain—it erodes the skull and hijacks the immune system within skull marrow.

articles.title: A Plant Compound Might Be the Secret Weapon Against Gum Disease
articles.summary: A team of researchers tested morin, a plant compound, against gum disease bacteria and found strong antimicrobial benefits.

articles.title: Stunning Images Reveal How Antibiotics Shatter Bacterial Defenses
articles.summary: Researchers have revealed how polymyxins, crucial last-resort antibiotics, break down bacterial armor by forcing cells to overproduce and shed it.

articles.title: The Hidden Iron Switch That Makes Cancer Cells Self-Destruct
articles.summary: Scientists discovered that inhibiting the enzyme STK17B forces multiple myeloma cells into iron-driven death and makes therapies more effective.

articles.title: Doctors Stunned by a Cheap Drug’s Power Against Colon Cancer
articles.summary: A Scandinavian clinical trial has revealed that low-dose aspirin can halve the risk of colon and rectal cancer recurrence in patients with specific genetic mutations.

articles.title: Common Medications May Secretly Rewire Your Gut for Years
articles.summary: Drugs taken years—even decades—ago can leave lasting imprints on the gut microbiome, reshaping the community of microbes long after treatment stops.

articles.title: New Pill Could Finally Control Stubborn High Blood Pressure
articles.summary: A new pill called baxdrostat may offer hope for people whose blood pressure stays high even after taking standard medications.
